links.title: FAQ
links.content:
[Skip to main Content](#content)

[ ![Applied DNA Sciences IR](https://investors.adnas.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/775/2021/06/logo.png) ](https://investors.adnas.com "Link to Applied DNA Sciences IR homepage")

[Go to Corporate Home Page](https://adnas.com/ "Link to Go to Corporate Home Page")

# FAQ

What does Applied DNA Sciences do? 

Applied DNA Sciences is a biotechnology company developing and commercializing technologies to produce and detect DNA and RNA. Using PCR to enable the production and detection of DNA and RNA, we operate in three primary business markets: (i) the enzymatic manufacture of synthetic DNA for use in the production of nucleic acid-based therapeutics (including biologics and drugs) and, through our recent acquisition of Spindle Biotech, Inc. (“Spindle”), the development and sale of a proprietary RNA polymerase (“RNAP”) for use in the production of messenger RNA (“mRNA”) therapeutics (“Therapeutic DNA Production Services”); (ii) the detection of DNA and RNA in molecular diagnostics and genetic testing services (“MDx Testing Services”); and (iii) the manufacture and detection of DNA for industrial supply chain security services (“DNA Tagging and Security Products and Services”).

Our growth strategy is to primarily focus our resources on the further development, commercialization, and customer adoption of our Therapeutic DNA Production Services, including the expansion of our contract development and manufacturing operation (“CDMO”) for the manufacture of synthetic DNA for use in the production of nucleic acid-based therapies, and to further expand and commercialize our MDx Testing Services through genetic testing.

Where is the Company headquartered? 

The Applied DNA Sciences Inc. corporate headquarters are located at:

50 Health Sciences Drive Stony Brook, NY 11790 Tel +1-631-240-8800 Fax +1-631-240-8900

Where is the Company incorporated? 

Applied DNA Sciences is a Delaware corporation.

What is the Company's fiscal year? 

Applied DNA Sciences fiscal year ends September 30.

On which exchange is the Company's common stock traded? 

Applied DNA Sciences common stock is traded on The NASDAQ Capital Market under the ticker symbol APDN.

Applied DNA Sciences warrants are traded on the OTC Markets under the ticker symbol APPDW.

What is the Company's current shares outstanding count? 

Approximately 50.9 million shares of common stock are outstanding as of November 11, 2024.

Who are the Company's auditors? 

Marcum LLP 10 Melville Park Road Melville, NY Tel: 631 414 4000 Fax: 631 414 4001 <http://www.marcumllp.com>

Who is the Company's transfer agent? How do I transfer stock, change the address on my shareholder account, or replace a lost stock certificate? 

Equiniti Trust Company Tel: [(800) 937-5449](tel:8009375449) OR [(718) 921-8124](tel:7189218124) URL: <https://equiniti.com/us/ast-access/individuals/>

The transfer agent is responsible for maintaining all records of stockholders (including change of address, telephone number, and name), canceling or issuing stock certificates, and resolving problems related to lost, destroyed, or stolen certificates.

Can I buy stock directly from the Company? 

No, Applied DNA Sciences does not offer a direct stock purchase plan. All purchases of stock must be made in the public market.

Does the Company pay a dividend? 

No, Applied DNA Sciences does not pay dividends at this time.

How can I view documents the Company has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its Forms 10-Qs and 10-Ks? 

SEC filings are available at the following address: [SEC Filings](https://otc-ir-adnas.mz-sites.com/sec-filings/)

How do I contact Investor Relations to obtain more information about the Company? 

Please contact Sanjay M. Hurry Executive Director, Investor Relations and Corporate Communications E: sanjay.hurry@adnas.com M: 917-733-5573
